poker.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.model.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the main game loop.

    This class automatically plays multiple tournaments (tables) in one giant game loop and tracks the winner distibution.
    Author:
    Becker

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(AbstractPlayer[] players,
    int gameCount,
    boolean updateGui)
        Constructor using default values for Stack Size, Start Blind and Number of Hands until increasinsg Blinds.

        Automatically starts the main game loop which means, that gameCount tournaments will be played and the winner distribution will be tracked.
        Parameters:
        players - An array with AbstractPlayer instances.
        gameCount - The games to be played.
        updateGui - Should the GUI be updated?

      • Game

        public Game(AbstractPlayer[] players,
    int gameCount,
    int startStack,
    int startBlind,
    int increaseBlind,
    boolean updateGui)
        Constructor with maximal flexibility.

        Automatically starts the main game loop which means, that gameCount tournaments will be played and the winner distribution will be tracked.
        Parameters:
        players - An array with AbstractPlayer instances.
        gameCount - The games to be played.
        startStack - The startstack for each game.
        startBlind - The startblind for each game.
        increaseBlind - The amount of hands after which the blinds are increased.
        updateGui - Should the GUI be updated?

    • Method Detail

      • getWinCount

        public int[] getWinCount()
        Tracks the winner distribution.
        Returns:
        an array of integers representing the amount of tables won by each participating player.

      • start

        private void start()
